content: Hey, not sure if people caught it, but it seems that Jetbrains new IDE ("Fleet", closed beta) is using an unspecified LSP server to support Rust: https://www.jetbrains.com/help/fleet/smart-mode.html#workspace-security. I believe this is a departure of their Rust support for CLion.
When you enable smart mode, Fleet launches a particular type of backend depending on the language. For example, Java is handled by IntelliJ IDEA, whereas Rust support is provided by a LSP server.
Wasn't sure if people caught on to that, but figured it was interesting enough to mention (:

They're using RA, but I don't see why they couldn't switch to the CLion implementation if they wanted to: https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/sxzyk5/rustanalyzer_joins_the_rust_organization_rust_blog/hxy3w5w/?context=3
Oh cool, hadn't seen the reddit thread. Just happened to google for "fleet LSP" today, and found this snippet heh
